result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam D. Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant must obtain his GED/HSED.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into bars/taverns.
Eligible for expunction upon successful completion of probation.
The defendant must take all medications that are prescribed to him and in the manner in which they are prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Defendant must complete within the 1st year of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam D. Short

records.addlTxt: of failure to meet conditions for expungement along with letter from P&P agent

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam D. Short in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:35 PM. Kronenwetter - resolved. State - amend count #1 to possession of a Schedule I or II narcotic contrary to 946.41(3g)(am), plead G to amended count #1, dismiss and read in #2, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 90 days of conditional jail, court costs, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or entry into any bar or tavern, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider. Short and Kronenwetter agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Court amends count #1 to possession of a Schedule I or II narcotic contrary to 961.41(3g)(am) - reads new charge and penalty. Short pleads G to amended count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT. Court accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - no objections to expunction upon successful completion of probation. Kronenwetter makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for 45 days to report for stated reasons. Short withholds sentence. State commends the defendant on efforts he has taken to better himself. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions as follows: 90 days of conditional jail - report no later than 4:30 PM on 1/22/16 - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), court costs - paid thru probation, 100 hours of community service - to be performed within the first year of probation, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED/HSED, take all medications that are prescribed to him and in the manner in which they are prescribed. maintain/obtain full time employment/school, AODA and follow thru, eligible for expunction upon successful completion of probation, submit DNA sample - gives expunction rights, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Attorney Jay Kronenwetter in court but appears telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:01 PM. Kronenwetter informs Court that they had reached a resolution but states that his client is currently incarcerated in Brown County Jail. Court continues bond, sets for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adam D. Short in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:48 PM. State - all parties are in agreement to adjourn.  Court will adjourn. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Adam D. Short in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:34 AM. State calls Deputy Collette. Collette sworn in at 9:35 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (9:46 AM). Collette excused at 9:48 AM. No further witnesses for either party. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Kronenwetter has Information, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Kronenwetter may be filing a motion to suppress. Court accepts plea, continues bond, get a MH date from JA if needed and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
